intro: Chaetanthera linifolia, commonly known as the silky nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its common name. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, dark seeds.
